title: Michael Myers
description: The silent, unstoppable force of evil from the 'Halloween' series, known for his white mask and relentless pursuit of his victims.

title: Haddonfield, Illinois
description: The fictional town where Michael Myers returns to terrorize its residents on Halloween night.

title: Freddy Krueger
description: The burned, claw-gloved villain from 'A Nightmare on Elm Street,' who kills teenagers in their dreams.

title: Elm Street
description: The iconic street where Freddy Krueger haunts the dreams of the local teenagers.

title: One, two, Freddy's coming for you...
description: The chilling nursery rhyme that signals Freddy Krueger's approach in 'A Nightmare on Elm Street.'

title: Jason Voorhees
description: The hockey mask-wearing, machete-wielding killer from 'Friday the 13th,' who stalks the woods of Camp Crystal Lake.

title: Camp Crystal Lake
description: The summer camp where Jason Voorhees terrorizes counselors and victims with his deadly machete.

title: Chucky
description: The possessed doll from 'Child's Play,' known for his maniacal grin and penchant for chaos.

title: Pennywise the Clown
description: The terrifying clown from Stephen King's 'It,' who lures children into the sewers of Derry.

title: Derry, Maine
description: The cursed town where Pennywise preys on the fears of the local children in Stephen King's 'It.'

title: We all float down here...
description: The creepy phrase Pennywise uses to lure his victims into the sewers in 'It.'

title: Ghostface
description: The masked killer from the 'Scream' series, known for tormenting victims over the phone before attacking.

title: Woodsboro, California
description: The fictional town where the Ghostface killings occur in the 'Scream' series.

title: Do you like scary movies?
description: Ghostface's iconic question to his victims before attacking in 'Scream.'

title: Dracula
description: The classic vampire from Bram Stoker's novel, a suave and deadly creature who preys on humans for their blood.

title: Transylvania
description: The legendary home of Count Dracula, known for its gothic castles and dark forests.

title: Frankenstein's Monster
description: The misunderstood creation of Dr. Frankenstein, a towering figure stitched together from corpses.

title: Castle Frankenstein
description: The gloomy castle where Dr. Frankenstein conducts his experiments to create life in his monster.

title: The Wicked Witch of the West
description: The green-skinned villain from 'The Wizard of Oz,' who seeks revenge for her sister's death.

title: The Yellow Brick Road
description: The path Dorothy follows in 'The Wizard of Oz' to reach the Emerald City, avoiding the Wicked Witch's traps.

title: The Joker
description: Batmanâ€™s arch-nemesis, a psychotic clown with a twisted sense of humor and love for chaos.

title: Gotham City
description: The crime-ridden metropolis where Batman fights his rogues' gallery, including the Joker.

title: Why so serious?
description: The Joker's infamous line from 'The Dark Knight,' highlighting his twisted philosophy on life.

title: Beetlejuice
description: The chaotic 'bio-exorcist' from Tim Burton's 'Beetlejuice,' who loves trouble and mischief.

title: 'Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice!'
description: The phrase that summons Beetlejuice, the mischievous ghost, in the film of the same name.

title: Regan MacNeil
description: The possessed girl from 'The Exorcist,' whose transformation under demonic influence is horrifying.

title: The power of Christ compels you!
description: The famous line from 'The Exorcist,' spoken during the exorcism to drive the demon out of Regan.

title: The Headless Horseman
description: The ghostly rider from 'The Legend of Sleepy Hollow,' who searches for his missing head.

title: Sleepy Hollow
description: The haunted town where Ichabod Crane encounters the Headless Horseman in Washington Irving's story.

title: Jack Skellington
description: The Pumpkin King of Halloween Town from 'The Nightmare Before Christmas,' who wants to take over Christmas.
